skill.name: testing-strategy
skill.description: Comprehensive testing strategy using Vitest for unit/integration tests and Playwright for E2E tests with best practices and coverage targets
skill.summary: Comprehensive testing strategy using Vitest for unit/integration tests and Playwright for E2E tests ...
skill.author: AI-Vibe-Prompts

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only markdown guidance for testing practices. Contains no executable code, scripts, or network calls. All example code snippets are legitimate testing patterns for Vitest and Playwright.

content.value_statement: Developers struggle to implement consistent testing practices across projects. This skill provides structured guidance for unit, integration, and E2E testing using Vitest and Playwright with clear coverage targets and best practices.
actual_capabilities: Guide implementation of unit tests with Vitest and React Testing Library
Set up integration tests for component interactions and API calls
Configure Playwright for end-to-end browser testing
Define coverage targets (80%+ lines, 80% functions, 75% branches)
Apply AAA pattern and test naming conventions
Create CI/CD testing workflows with GitHub Actions
limitations: Does not execute tests directly - provides guidance only
Does not install dependencies or configure project files
Does not generate test files automatically
Requires user to implement recommended patterns in their codebase

use_cases.title: Set up React testing
use_cases.description: Configure Vitest with React Testing Library and achieve 80% coverage on component tests

use_cases.title: Create E2E test suite
use_cases.description: Build Playwright tests for critical user flows like authentication and checkout

use_cases.title: Automate testing in CI
use_cases.description: Configure GitHub Actions to run tests and upload coverage reports on every push

prompt_templates.title: Basic test setup
prompt_templates.prompt: Help me set up testing with Vitest and React Testing Library for my React project. I want to achieve 80% code coverage.

prompt_templates.title: E2E testing
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a Playwright test for user registration and login flows. Include assertions for page navigation and success messages.

prompt_templates.title: Coverage improvement
prompt_templates.prompt: My project has 60% test coverage. Identify low-coverage areas and suggest tests to reach 80% coverage on lines and functions.

prompt_templates.title: CI integration
prompt_templates.prompt: Set up GitHub Actions workflow that runs Vitest with coverage, uploads reports to Codecov, and runs Playwright tests on push.

output_examples.input: Set up Vitest testing for my React component with proper mocking
output: Create vitest.config.ts with jsdom environment and coverage thresholds
Write unit test with AAA pattern (Arrange, Act, Assert)
Mock external API calls using vi.mock()
Add assertions for rendering and user interactions
Run coverage report to verify 80%+ threshold

best_practices: Follow the testing pyramid: 70% unit tests, 20% integration tests, 10% E2E tests
Use descriptive test names that explain what and when (not just 'works' or 'test 1')
Mock external dependencies to keep tests fast and isolated
anti_patterns: Testing implementation details instead of behavior
Writing multiple unrelated assertions in a single test
Skipping error state and edge case testing
Running full E2E suite on every code change instead of using unit tests for fast feedback

faq.question: Which tools does this skill support?
faq.answer: Vitest for unit/integration tests and Playwright for end-to-end browser testing.

faq.question: What coverage targets should I aim for?
faq.answer: Minimum 80% lines, 80% functions, 75% branches. Critical paths should reach 100%.

faq.question: Can I use this with other test frameworks?
faq.answer: The skill focuses on Vitest and Playwright but principles apply to Jest and Cypress with minor adjustments.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This skill provides only documentation guidance. It reads no files and sends no data externally.

faq.question: Why are my tests failing in CI but passing locally?
faq.answer: Check for environment differences, timing issues, or mocked dependencies that behave differently in CI. Use consistent setup and fake timers.

faq.question: How is this different from Jest?
faq.answer: Vitest shares Jest API but runs faster with Vite, supports TypeScript natively, and works better with modern frameworks.
